name: sfchronicle
text:
In her normal, pre-pandemic life, UCSF’s Dr. Maria Raven liked to unwind on a Saturday night by whipping up a Mediterranean-inspired dinner for 20. 

Here’s how she’s adapting to the pandemic: https://t.co/HEQfbsH2Ai

name: sfchronicle
text: The California Legislature has less than a month left in its pandemic-shortened session to deal with one of the state’s worst economic crises in decades, and there’s no greater emergency than what to do about the rent. https://t.co/YlTGTiaNtV

name: sfchronicle
text:
How California reduced its inmate population to a 30-year low.

Story by @BobEgelko: https://t.co/i0e9Lwj7Wt

name: sfchronicle
text: Some are elaborately built. Others look flimsy. As S.F. restaurants take over parking spaces for outdoor dining, @JohnKingSFChron weighs in on urban design for the pandemic age. https://t.co/hhW1VEnqe2

name: sfchronicle
text: “I used to get tormented a little bit,” Toney said. “Black kids in my neighborhood would say, ‘What are you doing? We don’t play golf.’ And white kids at the course would say, ‘You don’t belong out here.’ All that did was motivate me more.” https://t.co/h26pI1oPLD

name: sfchronicle
text: As a pandemic playbook has emerged for moving, working and socializing remotely in the Bay Area, new ways to make friends have also grown organically out of the disruption caused by the coronavirus. https://t.co/GHMcGCvfJC

name: sfchronicle
text: Several bills are moving through the Legislature to prevent what many worry could be a wave of evictions. But landlord groups and tenant advocates are divided. https://t.co/5dsXhm1Zu4

name: sfchronicle
text: Dining in the Bay Area has changed during the pandemic thanks to automation. But it’s looking more like the technology isn’t just a temporary fix, and will continue to grow long after the pandemic comes to an end. https://t.co/CkmqCOwnhr

name: sfchronicle
text: Health vetting, risk assessment, masked erotica and going virtual. Here's how relationships, new and old, are changing in the pandemic: https://t.co/G71hQXI862

name: sfchronicle
text: In her pre-pandemic life, UCSF’s Dr. Maria Raven liked to unwind on a Saturday night by whipping up a Mediterranean-inspired dinner for 20. Adapting to COVID means fewer guests, assigned seats and banishing the buffet. https://t.co/4McU7cRi7h

name: sfchronicle
text:
The 49ers’ Super Bowl window is open in 2020. Good thing, as the financial impact of the pandemic on the NFL's future salary caps means their championship-caliber roster might need to be significantly overhauled in 2021.

https://t.co/GlPgLpNKay

name: sfchronicle
text:
#SFGiants blow three-run lead, fall to Rockies after inevitable Arenado home run.

Story by @HankSchulman: https://t.co/KTGF1L9tjw

name: sfchronicle
text: “I’ve always been told, ‘Don’t make friends online.’ I heard terrible, terrible stories. But I think that different social platforms are making it a lot more safe, and it’s definitely becoming more socially acceptable." https://t.co/9dzBHjz2zv

name: sfchronicle
text:
California Supreme Court says no go to referendum challenges to certain state laws.

Story by @BobEgelko: https://t.co/x18KJFYru1

name: sfchronicle
text: S.F.'s @OmRecords, known for its eclectic mix of electronic music, celebrates 25 years: https://t.co/17utuwp4pj

name: sfchronicle
text: “There’s also a strange sense of intense fatigue... seeing how far we’ve come, and realizing we don’t know where we have to go.” @mccalmanco talked to three Bay Area restaurant owners on life amid the pandemic: https://t.co/G2b4VuIDzu

name: sfchronicle
text: “Yes, we serve drinks, but every bar is also a community. That’s why people need to speak up — our public officials need to know that these are beloved places.” https://t.co/sG02NRMHqj

name: sfchronicle
text: Conversations online turned quickly to socially distanced walks, picnics in the park — and often, friendship. Everyone was doing it. https://t.co/ITAafA4MRL

name: sfchronicle
text: San Francisco sex coach Myisha Battle on exposure vetting, virtual dating and why it’s weird to expect someone to camp on a first date. https://t.co/ABkR6gbi0j
